intro: Psychotria rufocalyx, commonly known as the red-veined psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its strikingly veined leaves, which display a deep red coloration on the underside. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. Psychotria rufocalyx is also notable for its role in traditional medicine and as a habitat for various insects and birds.
